text.titleText: Hello! I'm Alexander, the one who makes pixels work
text.textOne1: I am 24 years old. My journey in IT began at 18, when I created my own game for my phone.
text.textOne2: Over the next two years, I realized that game development wasn't exactly what I wanted to do.
text.textOne3: In search of a new direction, I discovered for myself
text.textTwo1: I started learning web development on my own, through online materials.
text.textTwo2: Yes, it's not the most reliable way, but it gave me basic knowledge and practice.
text.textTwo3: I completed small tasks, made edits to projects, and learned something new with each step.

cart.title: HTML
cart.text: I mark up semantically. I work confidently with forms, tables, and media.

cart.title: CSS
cart.text: I know Flexbox and Grid, and I create responsive and cross-browser interfaces.

cart.title: SCSS
cart.text: Using variables, nesting, mixins for structure and style reuse.

cart.title: JS
cart.text: I write clean code, work with DOM, events, and asynchrony (fetch, async/await).

cart.title: Figma
cart.text: I use it to view layouts, work with UI/UX, and adapt the design for layout.

cart.title: Problem Solving
cart.text: I quickly find solutions even in difficult situations. I use logic, creativity, and experience to overcome technical and non-technical challenges.

cart.title: Gallery creation project
cart.text: The gallery is created as a slider using HTML, CSS and JS

footer: Daytime is deadlines, evening is frameworks, night is bugs, and life is Front-End Developer.
